msbt.message: Hey, that horned dynastid looks like a sharp customer, am I right? A poke from that would be dy-nasty!
The pincers on this giant stag are so cool. They're, like, built-in flair!
They call this a saw stag, huh? Well, I saw it, but I'm not sure I ever need to see it again!
So this thing is the horned hercules of the insect kingdom? <10_4 />Oh, that's just its name? Well, it's a powerful brand. I like the way this insect markets itself.
I don't really like the way this mantis is looking at me
Whoa, that's the most beautiful butterfly I've ever seen!What do you mean, it's called a Madagascan sunset moth?! That's no moth, !
Now THIS is my kind of beetle. Sparkle and swag, just the way nature intended.
Ahh, I love to see these beauties in action, flying majestically through the air. And what a great name! Someone knew what they were doing when they called it a great purple emperor!
That jewel beetle is SO pretty. It's like it's wearing a rainbow
I like how the agrias butterfly is both red and blue. It's likewhat mood are you in today?
Just looking at the brilliant blue of that emperor butterfly makes mesuper jealous of its swag.
Fireflies are so pretty at nightIt's cool how they just light up a space like a young , .
Whoa, what a big butterfly!<10_4 /> Oh, it's an Atlas moth? Meh, I've seen bigger.
Now THAT is butterfly royalty if I've ever seen it. And it's even called Queen Alexandra's birdwing!
Um, should this scorpion be doing these kind of scorpion things right now? I'm kind of worried
Gah! A wasp! I'm allergic to my own fear of wasps!
Hmm, this firefly isn't nearly as impressive in the daytime. Quick, someone turn off the sun!
Oh, my This man-faced stink bug looks exactly like my uncle!
I can't tell which one is the walking leaf and which one is the just-chillin' leaf
Listen! Do you hear the soothing song of the bell cricket? I'm gonna get that as a ringtone!
Can you imagine slipping out of your shell and leaving it behind?It's gotta be like slipping out of a stuffy tuxedo after an awards show.
Being as pretty as this beetle is nice, but it can't be easy. Ask me how I know.
This damselfly is simply the most exquisite, fragile thing! I want 100 of them to live in my parlor!
Yeah, sorry not sorry about THIS little monster being trapped under glass. Stop biting everyone, mosquito!
Oh, heyyou actually donated this one, didn't you? It's so cool that I know a benefactor in real life!
Ack! The and the are fighting!
